Description: Diptych; ivory; leaf; four subjects in two compartments; each with canopy of four arches and sub-divided by central column; below: Massacre of the Innocents; pursuit of Child by Herod's men (Cornfield); on left Herod watches murders, on right peasant amongst corn; above: Flagellation and Crucifixion.
Curator's comments: Randall in 'Masterpieces of Ivory from the Walters Collection' (1985) draws parallels between the figure style of this piece and a diptych in the Walters Art Gallery, Baltimore, catalogue number 308, museum number 71.177
Bibliographic references: Dalton 1909 / Catalogue of the Ivory Carvings of the Christian Era with Examples of Mohammedan Art and Carvings in Bone in the Department of British and Mediaeval Antiquities and Ethnography of the British Museum (306)
